jchess.ruleengine

Interface IRuleEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultRuleEngine, ExtendedRuleEngine, ThreePlayersHexBoardRuleEngine

    public interface IRuleEngine
    This interface aims to provide abstraction to classes that should provide functionality to process and execute no just the rules that can be defined in the XML, but also entertain the custom rules that are not XML supportable. The classes should evaluate the pieces and, with the help of the rules defined against them, the should finds out all the possible move candidates the piece can perform. They should also facilitate the game engine in the execution of the rules. This interface provides abstraction to different Rule Engines. It is designed to keep the rule processing functionality loosely coupled to the main game logic therefore developer can create different code files for different boards.
    Since:
    7 Dec 2019
    Author:
    Sajad Karim
